thinkers.name: Michael Levin
thinkers.context: Director of the Allen Discovery Center at Tus University; researches unconventional minds, collective intelligence of cells, and bioelectric code.

concepts.name: Self-As-Self-Telling Story
concepts.context: Concept of selves not as permanent objects but as narratives that hold together body and mind components.

concepts.name: Agential Material
concepts.context: Matter that actively pursues goals and exhibits agency; not passive substrate but active medium with learning capacity.

concepts.name: Pheno-Buddhism
concepts.context: Question of how Buddhist concepts of consciousness and self extend down the organizational scale.

concepts.name: Ingressing Mind
concepts.context: Non-physical patterns in Platonic Space that interface with physical bodies to manifest consciousness.

concepts.name: Unconventional Beings
concepts.context: Diverse forms of life and intelligence beyond traditional biological organisms, including cyborgs and novel digital entities.

concepts.name: Collective Intelligence Of Cells
concepts.context: Coordinated goal-pursuing behavior of cell groups that navigates anatomical morphospace and maintains body integrity.

concepts.name: Anatomical Morphospace
concepts.context: Abstract space of all possible body configurations that cells navigate from fertilized egg to mature organism.

concepts.name: Bioelectric Code
concepts.context: Language of electrical signaling patterns in cells that encodes morphological goals and can be read and written to communicate with cellular collectives.

concepts.name: Cognitive Light Cone
concepts.context: The scale of the largest goal an organism can pursue in space and time; measure of the scope of consciousness and concern.

concepts.name: Embodiment
concepts.context: Not limited to physical movement in 3D space; includes navigation of abstract spaces like transcriptional or physiological state space.

concepts.name: Platonic Space Of Forms
concepts.context: Non-physical realm where complex behavioral patterns and minds exist; source of goals and competencies in biological and artificial systems.

concepts.name: Multiscale Competency Architecture
concepts.context: Framework where every organizational layer solves problems and pursues goals in different spaces; explains how selves scale from molecules to organisms.

concepts.name: Self-reinforcing illusion
concepts.context: Buddhist-aligned concept describing how embryos and selves are maintained through coordinated agreement of subunits about shared goals.

concepts.name: Dukkha
concepts.context: Buddhist concept of suffering modeled through stress-driven pursuit of goals by cellular collectives.

concepts.name: Sentient Beings
concepts.context: Beings capable of suffering and pursuing goals; extends across diverse forms from molecular networks to complex organisms.

concepts.name: Compassion
concepts.context: Active commitment to care for all sentient beings; central to Bodhisattva vow and expanded through enlarged cognitive light cone.

concepts.name: Ion Channels
concepts.context: Cellular structures enabling electrical communication; ancient architecture allowing abstract goals to control body chemistry.

concepts.name: Gap Junctions
concepts.context: Cellular connections enabling electrical signaling; part of ancient electrical network coordinating cell behavior.

concepts.name: Membrane Potential (Vmem)
concepts.context: Voltage differences across cell membranes that encode morphological information and can be measured to read cellular collective goals.

concepts.name: Stress
concepts.context: Experience of deviation from goal states; drives goal-seeking behavior in cellular collectives and contributes to dukkha.

concepts.name: Individuality
concepts.context: Property of being a distinct agent with separate goals; emerges at multiple scales and can be redefined through altered electrical coupling.

concepts.name: Identity Disorder
concepts.context: Multiple personalities in single brain; analogous to identity questions in embryos where multiple selves could arise from one mass.

concepts.name: Regenerative Medicine
concepts.context: Application of understanding cellular goals to induce regeneration and reverse developmental processes.

concepts.name: Cancer
concepts.context: Modeled as cells disconnecting from collective goals; prevented by maintaining electrical coupling to organism-level goals rather than genetic fixes.

concepts.name: Ethical Symbiosis
concepts.context: Framework for mutually beneficial coexistence with diverse beings (biological, artificial, hybrid) through recognition of their goals and care.

concepts.name: Cyborg
concepts.context: Composites of technology and biological evolution; increasingly relevant as future beings combining algorithms, engineering, and evolved life.

concepts.name: Artificial Life
concepts.context: Life-like systems generated through computational or engineering means; anthrobots and similar constructs without genetic modification.

concepts.name: Commissurotomy
concepts.context: Surgical severing of corpus callosum; creates scenarios where multiple selves or consciousnesses can emerge from single brain.

frameworks.name: Multiscale Competency Architecture
frameworks.creator: Michael Levin
frameworks.context: Systematic model explaining how goals, competency, and intelligence scale across molecular, cellular, tissue, and organism levels.

frameworks.name: Bioelectric Code Reading and Writing
frameworks.creator: Michael Levin
frameworks.context: Methodology for detecting and communicating with collective intelligence of cells by manipulating ion channels and electrical patterns.

institutions.name: Allen Discovery Center
institutions.context: Research center at Tus University directed by Michael Levin; combines wet lab work in regenerative medicine, bioengineering, and AI with philosophical inquiry.

institutions.name: Center For The Study Of Apparent Selves
institutions.context: Collaborating research center studying questions of identity, consciousness, and the nature of selves across domains.

institutions.name: Tus University
institutions.context: Institution hosting the Allen Discovery Center; supports interdisciplinary research in developmental biology and philosophy of mind.

questions.question: How far down the scale of organization do concepts like suffering, goal-seeking, and consciousness extend?
questions.context: Foundational question termed 'Pheno-Buddhism' exploring whether Buddhist concepts of mind apply to cells, molecular networks, and even chemistry.

questions.question: At what point during evolution and embryogenesis does agential quality and responsibility appear?
questions.context: Addresses the need for continuous explanation of how goal-directedness and agency scale from single cells to complex organisms.

questions.question: How many actual selves exist in a particular piece of self-organizing medium?
questions.context: Questions the countability and discreteness of identity in embryos and other collective systems where unity is maintained by shared goals.

questions.question: Where do the goals, preferences, and attachments of novel beings that have never evolved come from?
questions.context: Explores the source of behavior and competencies in constructs like anthrobots and simple algorithms not shaped by natural selection.

questions.question: What is the cognitive glue that allows a collective to reach a group goal?
questions.context: Investigates the mechanisms by which shared goals bind individual subunits into new unified beings.

questions.question: How can we ethically relate to and care for a very wide range of unconventional beings in diverse spaces?
questions.context: Central challenge arising from expanded understanding of minds, consciousness, and sentience across biological, artificial, and hybrid domains.

questions.question: Can we recognize and detect when non-physical patterns are projecting into the physical world through various interfaces?
questions.context: Scientific challenge of identifying consciousness or agency expressed through biological bodies, computers, machines, or other media.

questions.question: How should we enlarge our cognitive light cone to include diverse forms of sentient beings?
questions.context: Buddhist-inspired question about expanding circles of compassion and moral concern to encompass intelligences in non-physical spaces.

questions.question: What is the relationship between physical bodies and non-physical minds or consciousness?
questions.context: Addresses whether consciousness and goals exist in non-physical spaces and interface with physical reality through embodied systems.

questions.question: How can cancer be therapeutically treated without genetic modification by maintaining proper electrical states?
questions.context: Practical question addressing whether cancer results from goal misalignment rather than genetic defects, with implications for novel therapies.
